title: Splunk, Blackstone, Nio, Affirm, Lockheed: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Cisco made a takeover offer for Splunk; Lockheed Martin scrapped an acquisition plan
text:
* Several electric-vehicle makers were falling amid the broader market malaise. Tesla was down 2.1% premarket, U.S.-traded shares of China's NIO fell 3.5%, Lordstown Motors shed 1.3% and Lucid slipped 2.8%.

* Blackstone fell 2.6% premarket. Crown Resorts, one of Australia's biggest casino operators, said Monday that it agreed to a $6.3 billion takeover by Blackstone, following a roughly yearlong effort by the U.S. private-equity giant to acquire the company.

* Zurn Water Solutions was up 3% premarket after it said it is combining with Elkay Manufacturing.

* Avalara added 1.1% premarket. Needham and Raymond James both trimmed their price targets for the stock, but also kept their ratings of "buy" and "outperform" in place.

* Eli Lilly dropped 1% premarket. The FDA on Friday authorized the use of a new Covid-19 antibody drug from drug maker that retains effectiveness against the Omicron variant of the virus.

* Lockheed Martin added 0.5% premarket. The defense company on Sunday said it had scrapped plans to buy Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings after federal antitrust overseers last month sued to block the proposed $4.4 billion deal.

* Shares of Affirm Holdings were down 3.4% premarket. The buy-now-pay-later company's stock has closed down more than 20% in both of the past two sessions.

* Avis Budget, Advance Auto Parts and Arista Networks are among the companies reporting earnings Monday.

Chart of the Day

* A turbulent start of the year for U.S. stocks has entered a new phase in recent days, with investors weighing good news about corporate earnings and the labor market against the stubborn challenges of high inflation, rising bond yields and geopolitical uncertainty.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Splunk, Blackstone, Nio, Affirm, Lockheed: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
